result.execSummary:
The defendant Wayne T. Cook Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Must obtain/maintain full time employment at the discretion of the probation agent.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended.
Defendant must provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Wayne T. Cook in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case 16CM02 and 16CM6.  Victim notification has been complied.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1 on 16CM2 and Ct. 3 on 16CM6.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court found plea given freely, voluntary, and intelligently; accepted plea.  Court found DE guilty on Ct. 1 in 16CM2 and Ct. 3 on 16CM6 and withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 1 year with conditions of: court costs;  DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; obtain/maintain full time employment; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  ba
Status conference on May 25, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Wayne T. Cook in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 09:15 am.  - rt
Victim request and order to remove no contact from Defendant's bond
Victim request and order to remove no contact from Defendant's bond

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall have no contact with L.C. dob: 12-10-1988.
Initial Appearance on February 23, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $150.00 cash bond and $350.00 signature bond with conditions of: booking and no contact with L.C.  Court ordered $1,000.00 signature bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for February 23, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. - ba
